body_html:
it's not typical at all, there's something weird going on, but it's not the GPU memory.

Usually freezing indicates two things:

  • you are running out of CPU memory and you are hitting disk swap
  • a lot of hardware (say PCI-e or faulty GPU) / disk errors are being generated and the kernel is coping up with it slowly.

I wonder if your case is either of them.

body:
it's not typical at all, there's something weird going on, but it's not the GPU memory.

Usually freezing indicates two things:
- you are running out of CPU memory and you are hitting disk swap
- a lot of hardware (say PCI-e or faulty GPU) / disk errors are being generated and the kernel is coping up with it slowly.

I wonder if your case is either of them.
